active_projects.description: Implement multi-family saturated BMCS construction to eliminate singleFamily_modal_backward_axiom. Currently bmcs_weak_completeness depends on this axiom (Construction.lean line 228). A multi-family saturated bundle would prove modal backward direction without axiom. Requires completing SaturatedConstruction.lean sorries (12 sorries, related to Task 838). This enables Task 843 (remove axiom). Critical for making BMCS approach publication-ready without axiom disclosure.

artifacts.summary: Initial analysis of multi-family saturated BMCS construction approaches
Re-research verifying previous findings and identifying misleading comments
Mathematical correctness analysis comparing SaturatedConstruction (Option A) vs WeakCoherentBundle (Option B)

active_projects.description: Complete TruthLemma backward directions for all_future and all_past in Bundle/TruthLemma.lean (lines 383, 395). While NOT in bmcs_weak_completeness dependency chain (only uses .mp direction), completing these would make TruthLemma fully bidirectional. Requires omega-saturation. Cleanup task, not critical for publication. Related: Task 854 research-004.md

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of omega-saturation requirements, comparison with modal saturation, and recommendation to abandon task

active_projects.description: Take stock of the bimodal metalogic after completing tasks 851-854 (following 844). Audit to identify: (1) what has been established and how (theorems, axioms, dependencies), (2) what remains to be established for completeness, (3) what can be safely archived to Bimodal/Boneyard/ without breaking anything. Goal is a well-structured metalogic ready for publication.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive audit of bimodal metalogic: 3 axioms, 11 sorries, 4 archival candidates identified
Theoretical dependency flowchart for metalogic theorems with architectural recommendations for refactoring

Focused analysis confirming completeness theorems are correct - BMCS completeness is Henkin-style (valid for its validity notion), FMP completeness is axiom-free, both are mathematically sound when combined with standard soundness
Verified sorry/axiom dependencies: FMP approach is sorry-free and publication-ready; BMCS approach depends on one axiom (singleFamily_modal_backward_axiom)

active_projects.description: Construct CoherentBundle from consistent context as main entry point for completeness theorem integration. Build base family via Lindenbaum, construct constantIndexedMCSFamily, add coherent witnesses for all Diamonds using Zorn's lemma. Depends on tasks #851 and #852. (Follow-up from task #844, Phase 5)

artifacts.summary: Research report covering CoherentBundle construction strategy, existing infrastructure analysis, saturation approaches, and integration with completeness theorem
Follow-up investigation into proof blockers for saturated_extension_exists axiom and multi-family witness consistency gap
Deep analysis of Box-Closure approach for multi-family witness consistency, including complete construction flow, Lean implementation strategy, and WeakCoherentBundle alternative

Comparative analysis of three approaches for eliminating saturated_extension_exists axiom. Recommends Approach B (WeakCoherentBundle) as most mathematically tenable with lowest risk and 40-60 hour estimated effort.
Revised 5-phase plan using WeakCoherentBundle approach to eliminate saturated_extension_exists axiom. Separates core and witness families to avoid Lindenbaum control obstacle.
Implementation summary documenting changes, technical debt, and comparison to original approach

active_projects.completion_summary: Implemented WeakCoherentBundle approach for completeness theorem integration. Created new module with core/witness family separation that avoids the multi-family coherence obstacle. Introduced axiom weak_saturated_extension_exists (replacing saturated_extension_exists) and 3 documented sorries as technical debt. Full pipeline from consistent context to WeakBMCS is now available.

active_projects.description: Implement CoherentBundle.toBMCS conversion to provide axiom-free modal_backward. Uses contraposition: if phi in all families but Box phi not in fam.mcs, then Diamond(neg phi) in fam.mcs, so exists witness with neg phi, contradicting phi in all families. Depends on task #851 CoherentBundle structure. (Follow-up from task #844, Phase 4)

artifacts.summary: Research confirming task 852 is redundant - CoherentBundle.toBMCS was fully implemented in task 851

active_projects.completion_summary: Task subsumed by task 851. The CoherentBundle.toBMCS conversion was fully implemented in task 851 Phase 4 with no sorries. Both modal_forward and modal_backward proofs are complete.

active_projects.description: Define CoherentBundle structure that collects coherent witnesses with mutual coherence. Requires extending CoherentWitness to enforce coherence not just with base but between all witnesses. May require Zorn's lemma for recursive saturation. (Follow-up from task #844, Phase 3)

artifacts.summary: Research on CoherentBundle structure design, analyzing mutual coherence patterns, Zorn's lemma usage, and the constant-family approach to sidestep Lindenbaum control problems
5-phase implementation plan for CoherentBundle structure with mutual coherence via UnionBoxContent
Detailed implementation summary with verification results and remaining work documentation

active_projects.completion_summary: Implemented CoherentBundle structure with toBMCS conversion fully proven. Defines UnionBoxContent, MutuallyCoherent predicate, and proves modal_forward/modal_backward for saturated bundles. No sorries - complete infrastructure for axiom-free BMCS construction.
roadmap_items: Define CoherentBundle structure for multi-family mutual coherence

active_projects.description: Remove singleFamily_modal_backward_axiom after Zorn lemma is proven. Verify build succeeds and completeness theorems no longer depend on the axiom. (Follow-up from task #841, depends on task #842)

active_projects.description: Implement the .opencode system upgrade plan following specs/agent_system_upgrade_plan.md and specs/implementation_roadmap.md. This 6-week upgrade involves 4 phases: Phase 1 (Week 1): Foundation - file-based metadata exchange and state management; Phase 2 (Week 2): Workflow Ownership Migration - transfer postflight responsibilities to subagents; Phase 3 (Weeks 3-4): Meta System Builder Port - enable dynamic system extension; Phase 4 (Weeks 5-6): Forked Subagent Pattern - achieve token efficiency.

active_projects.description: Derive and prove 2 theorem groups in Logos Dynamics system based on TODO items: (1) line 200: Derive as theorem that every time in a world-history gets mapped to a world-state, then include remark discussing which constraints (from Containment subsection of counterfactual_worlds.tex line 1822) play a role in proving this theorem without assuming discreteness. Articulate theorem in Lean source with proof strategy in comments; (2) line 288: Derive Barcan formulas and prove their validity for the unrestricted quantifier and 'all possibly actual' quantifier. Similarly, show that the 'all sometimes actual' quantifier validates temporal analogs of Barcan formulas.

artifacts.summary: Research report on Evolution/WorldHistory containment theorem and Barcan formula proofs for Logos Dynamics

active_projects.description: Address 12 sorries in Bundle/SaturatedConstruction.lean. Task 827 research indicates 32-50 hours for mathematically correct completion. Options: complete implementation, document as accepted limitation, or simplify approach.

Add temporal_backward_G and temporal_backward_H properties to IndexedMCSFamily structure. These properties should mirror modal_backward in BMCS: temporal_backward_G states that if phi is in mcs at all future times t' >= t, then G phi is in mcs at t; temporal_backward_H states that if phi is in mcs at all past times t' <= t, then H phi is in mcs at t. For constantIndexedMCSFamily, prove these using T-axiom and MCS maximality (analogous to singleFamily_modal_backward_axiom). This eliminates sorries in TruthLemma.lean lines 383 and 395.

Remove misleading comments about omega-rule/omega-saturation requirement for G/H backward directions. The Bundled approach avoids omega-rule via structural properties (like modal_backward), not omega-saturation. Update TruthLemma.lean, IndexedMCSFamily.lean, Construction.lean, and any other files that incorrectly claim omega-saturation is fundamentally required. Replace with accurate explanation that temporal_backward properties enable the proof via maximality (analogous to modal case). Depends on Task 857 completing first.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of misleading omega-rule comments with specific replacement text for all affected files
4-phase implementation plan for removing misleading omega-rule comments from Bundle/ modules
Implementation summary documenting all comment changes across 3 files

active_projects.completion_summary: Removed misleading omega-rule comments from Bundle/ modules, replacing them with accurate explanations that temporal backward proofs require structural properties (temporal_backward_G/H) using MCS maximality by contraposition, the same pattern as modal_backward in BMCS. Updated documentation in TruthLemma.lean, Completeness.lean, and README.md.

artifacts.summary: 2-phase plan: attempt proof completion first, remove incomplete exercises as fallback
